title: The Wiggle's Lachlan Gillespie dotes over new girlfriend Dana Stephensen's child in adorable snap
text:
Lachlan Gillespie recently confirmed his romance with Australian ballerina Dana Stephensen.

But it seems The Wiggles star has already won over his new girlfriend's little boy Jasper.

In an image Dana posted to her Instagram story, Lachlan looked content as he cuddled the youngster.

'We love you': Wiggles star Lachlan Gillespie doted on his ballerina girlfriend Dana Stephensen's son on Wednesday following his split with Emma Watkins

She shared the photo with her 4,000 followers on Wednesday alongside the words 'We love you!'.

In it, four-year-old Jasper looked delighted as he smiled open-mouthed while sitting on Lachlan's lap.

The pop singer smiled as nuzzled the child's head in the adorable scene.

Ballet star Dana then shared a photograph of herself kissing Lachlan on the cheek, as she wished him a happy birthday.

Birthday wishes: Dana then shared a photograph of herself kissing Lachlan on the cheek

Earlier this month, the couple went 'Instagram official' by sharing their first photo together.

Fans soon congratulated Lachlan on finding love again after separating from Emma Watkins, a.k.a. The Yellow Wiggle, in August 2018, after two years of marriage.

Rumours surrounding Lachlan and Dana's romance had been picking up pace for some time.

While it's unclear when they officially began dating, they first met in December last year on set of The Wiggles' TV show.

Confirmed! Rumours surrounding Lachlan and Dana's romance had been picking up pace for some time

Emma, 30, and fellow band members Anthony Field and Simon Pryce are said to be 'really happy for Lachy', a source told The Sunday Telegraph in August.

They added: 'He and Emma remain friends and both want the best for one another.'

Dana was previously married to Melbourne-based photographer Michael Kai, with whom she shares custody of four-year-old Jasper.
description: Lachlan Gillespie recently confirmed his romance with Australian ballerina Dana Stephensen.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
